Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy and describe how it has water and light.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy and describe how it does not have water.
The student can draw a sun or a light source to show that plants need light to grow.
The student can draw water or raindrops to show that plants need water to grow.
The student can label the parts of the plant in their drawing (such as roots, stem, and leaves).
The student can draw two plants side by side to compare one with water and light and one without.
